definition:
Let $(a,b,c)$ be a triple of complex numbers with $c$ not belonging to
the set of negative integers. For a complex number $w$ and a non
negative integer $n$, use Pochhammer symbol $(w)_n$ , to denote the
expression : $$(w)_n=w(w+1)\dots(w+n-1).$$ The *Gauss hypergeometric
function*, $_{2}F_{1}$, is then defined by the following power series
expansion :
$$_2F_1(a,b;\,c\,;z)=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{(a)_n(b)_n}{(c)_{n}n!}z^n.$$
